headline: Assistant Chief Counsel at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

defaultPosition.description: Primarily, I represent the government in removal proceedings before the Immigration Court. This typically involves case review and cross-examination in cases where an individual has applied for relief from removal. I also appear before the court at master calendar, where pleadings are rendered, applications for relief are submitted, and cases are evaluated for whether they should proceed to an individual hearing. When I am not in court, I handle various other duties such as responses to motions, legal research and brief writing, responses to public or agency inquiries, and other rotating priorities as determined by headquarters.
defaultPosition.location: 201 Varick Street, Room 1130, New York, NY 10014
defaultPosition.title: Assistant Chief Counsel

positions.title: Assistant Chief Counsel

positions.companyName: Staff Attorneys' Office, United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit
positions.description: At the Staff Attorneys' Office, I wrote bench memoranda for the court in cases involving counseled motions or pro se litigants.  These memos summarized the case for an appellate panel, and ultimately made a recommendation as to how the court should rule.  The caseload chiefly involved petitions for habeas corpus, immigration law, employment law, and civil rights law, but occasionally touched on other areas such as intellectual property and securities law.
positions.title: Staff Attorney

positions.companyName: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
positions.title: Intern
